info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:23AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Winnebago and northern Boone Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 922 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Durand, or 7 miles west of Rockton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Machesney Park, Roscoe, South Beloit, Rockton, Pecatonica, Durand, Harrison, Shirland and Lake Summerset. Including the following interstate... I-90 between mile markers 1 and 7. This includes... Winnebago County Fairgrounds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
